Today, at the House Committee on Homeland Security hearing on border security, Congressman John Rutherford (FL-4) discussed coastal border safety with the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Secretary John Kelly.  Speaking about the hearing, Congressman Rutherford said, “As the administration focuses on securing our southern borders, it is important we continue to secure our coastal borders, as well. Cartels and drug runners seek to exploit our maritime borders for trafficking, and Florida plays a strategic role in drug interdiction at sea. The safety and security of the First Coast and the Port of Jacksonville must remain a top priority. I commend Secretary Kelly for his commitment to support our U.S. Coast Guard units and keep all borders safe. I look forward to working with him and the Committee further to ensure the safety and protection of all Americans.”

Thank you to Sgt. Beers and the men and women of the Jacksonville Sheriff's Office for your caring service to the Jacksonville community. Your commitment and compassion are greatly appreciated and do not go unnoticed. Keep up the good work!

Thank you President Donald J. Trump for standing behind our law enforcement officers who risk their lives every day to protect our communities. I applaud you for taking action to enhance the safety of our citizens and nation.  https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2017/02/09/presidential-executive-order-preventing-violence-against-federal-state
Enjoyed discussing the future of FEMA Federal Emergency Management Agency. Public safety, security, & preparedness are a priority in NE FL. Homeland Security Committee
Great news for Jacksonville and Mayport! U.S. Navy Chose Naval Station Mayport as the MQ-4C Triton Operating Base: http://bit.ly/2kzrdI4
It was wonderful meeting with Megan and the Special Olympics Florida team yesterday to discuss the great work they do and our passion for the 'Noles!

President Trump has made it very clear one of his priorities is to rebuild the Navy and their ships. I believe this effort should also include the United State Coast Guard. Productive meeting with Homeland Security Committee and Vice Admiral Charles Ray of the U.S. Coast Guard to make sure they have the resources needed to protect our maritime borders.

As the son of a WWII and Korean War veteran, it is my goal to reform the VA and do everything in my power to serve our veterans who deserve the care and respect they have earned. I am proud to represent thousands of veterans in Northeast Florida.   We need to be able to track how much time employees are using on official time, to make sure our veterans are getting the proper attention they deserve. I look forward to receiving the information I requested so the VA can determine how to best serve our veterans. House Committee on Veterans' Affairs Watch my questioning below:

History was made today at NAS Jacksonville! Wonderful to attend the historic Change of Command for Rear Admiral Mary Jackson & Rear Admiral Bette Bolivar as United States Navy Southeast Region Commander. Thank for your service and all you have done for the community and citizens of Northeast Florida. Congratulations and best wishes.

In Case You Missed It! Watch my interview with Wjxt4 Kent Justice on 'This Week in Jacksonville.' Looking forward to uniting with the 115th Congress to work hard for the people of Northeast Florida and the nation. http://www.news4jax.com/this-week-in-jacksonville/this-week-in-jacksonville-capitol-hill-battles
I was honored to be appointed to the Homeland Security Committee's Counterterrorism Task Force to prevent terrorism in the U.S. bit.ly/2l4HERY

Today during the joint hearing of the Senate and House Veterans Affairs Committee, Congressman Rutherford reaffirmed his committments to veterans: "I’ve often said how we treat our veterans is a national security issue. The volunteer military that we now enjoy is predicated upon us keeping our promises to those who already put their lives on the line, and put themselves in the breach to protect this country. I want to say thank you to each and everyone one of you [veterans] here. I think I speak on behalf of the committee when I say our commitment to you is to keep the commitments made in the past. God Bless You."

In response to President Trump’s Joint Address to Congress, Congressman Rutherford said, "President Trump ran on disrupting the status quo in Washington and turning this country around. His joint address gave an optimistic vision of the next four years that puts Americans first. I look forward to helping advance the priorities that will be most helpful to Northeast Florida, including rebuilding the military, investing in infrastructure, prioritizing the safety of our citizens, replacing Obamacare, and fulfilling our commitments to veterans."
I was proud to sponsor my first bill to stop wasteful spending at the Department of Homeland Security. Read more here: http://bit.ly/2lyrUBY
Happy Statehood Day to the great state of Florida!
Had a great time at the 25th annual World of Nations visiting with Northeast Florida residents from all different backgrounds. Thanks for your hospitality!

Looking forward to tomorrow's House Committee on Veterans' Affairs hearing with Secretary Shulkin of the Department of Veterans Affairs where we'll discuss improving timely access and community care for Northeast Florida veterans. It's important we give our brave veterans the care and respect they have earned!
Watch the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs hearing tonight at 7:30pm. We'll discuss improving access & care for NE FL vets. Tune in here: bit.ly/2mUmt5E
Today, the Homeland Security Committee approved Congressman Rutherford's bill to eliminate wasteful spending at the Department of Homeland Security. To read more click here: http://bit.ly/2mjAPcF

Today I voted to rebuild America's military and support national defense.The defense funding bill reinforces our promise to our military at home and abroad by dedicating the funding needed to keep our nation safe. Read more here: https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/rutherford-votes-fund-our-troops-and-national-defense
Great comradery among vets achieving a common goal: biking to help vets affected by injury & PTSD. Keep up the good work!
Great meeting with Major General Calhoun of the Florida National Guard and his team to discuss strengthening & supporting our guard in Northeast Florida.
In case you missed it!

I was proud to support the VA Accountability First Act that passed in the House of Representatives today. Northeast Florida is home to almost 100,000 veterans and this important bill will ensure all veterans get the care and respect they have earned. My colleagues and I have an obligation to our veterans who have sacrificed for our nation to improve accountability at the VA.   Passing this bill is another step in keeping that promise.

Looking forward to discussing repealing and replacing Obamacare at Mac Papers Envelope Converters with small business owners, Vice President Mike Pence,  CMS Administrator Seema Verma, and Governor Rick Scott. On my way back to Northeast Florida!
Had a great opportunity to discuss the importance of the military and ports to Jacksonville's future. Vice President Mike Pence and his staff were very gracious hosts.

Congressman Rutherford and the Florida Delegation sent a letter to U.S. Department of Defense Secretary Mattis and Acting Naval Secretary Stackley urging them to fully fund infrastructure to allow the United States Navy to base nuclear aircraft carriers at Naval Station Mayport in Jacksonville. Read more here: http://bit.ly/2mLyZQf

Thank you to the Nassau County Sheriff's Office, Florida Forest Service, Jacksonville Fire and Rescue Department, Jacksonville Sheriff's Office, Nassau County Fire-Rescue 3101, and Nassau EM crews for working tirelessly to keep Nassau County residents safe. Those near the fire should listen to all warnings and evacuation orders. My staff and I remain in contact with local and state officials to make sure first responders, firefighters, and residents have all they need to stay safe and secure. We continue to pray for all the families affected by the fire and the first responders who are working hard to keep everyone safe.

In case you missed it: Last week the House unanimously (408-0) passed my bill, H.R. 1294, the Reducing Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Acquisition Cost Growth Act. This bill would prevent wasteful spending of taxpayer dollars by agencies like the Transportation Security Administration (TSA), Customs and Border Protection, the U.S. Coast Guard, and the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), by holding DHS agencies more accountable in administering their major acquisition programs and granting Congress greater oversight over troubled programs.   Read more here: https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/legislative-update-first-rep-rutherford-bill-unanimously-passes-us-house

Tune in to Jeopardy tonight to watch Jacksonville's own Julie Brannon, a professor at Jacksonville University. She's a 2-day reigning champion and we look forward to watching her again tonight! Good luck! http://jacksonville.com/news/metro/2017-03-28/jeopardy-run-dream-come-true-jacksonville-university-professor

This horrific attack and blatant use of chemical weapons to murder and harm innocent families and children in Syria is unacceptable. I condemn this atrocious attack and will continue to to pray for those affected.
The Commander-in-Chief sent a very clear message - the United States will not stand idly by as innocents are murdered with chemical weapons. See the rest of my statement here: http://bit.ly/2ogwNEV

Over the weekend, I attended the Amelia Island Post Office historic dedication and celebrated its history since opening in 1912. Today, I attended the Rotary Club of St. Augustine meeting to give an update on our accomplishments in the first few months of Congress. I also held a round table with local fishermen and small businesses to discuss fishing industry challenges. Looking forward to many more productive meetings with constituents this week!

Hearing from the 4th district is essential to my job as your representative, and I enjoyed meeting with constituents in my district office. I appreciated the opportunity to listen to their concerns, share what I’m doing to fight for Northeast Floridians, and have constructive conversations about the issues important to our community.
I want to wish everyone a Happy Easter that is full of renewal, hope, and the joy of the risen Lord!

Today, I announced the Julian Woods Yellow Ribbon Program Expansion Act to enhance education benefits for families of fallen service members. I had the pleasure to meet Julian's mother Carolyn, to thank her and hear about the tremendous sacrifices her son and family made for our county.   To read more about the bill, click here: https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/rutherford-introduces-julian-woods-yellow-ribbon-program-expansion-act
In case you missed it - I led a congressional delegation to the southern border. Watch the recap here: bit.ly/2oZIOwC

The Department of Homeland (DHS) Security Office of Inspector General (OIG) issued a fraud alert to warn the public about a scam using the DHS OIG hotline telephone number. Scammers have identified themselves as “U.S. Immigration” employees and have altered their caller ID to seem like the call is coming from the DHS OIG hotline. If you are experiencing this issue, please click here for more information: http://bit.ly/2pRTxsv
It was an honor to preside on the house floor last night!

FEMA’s response to events like Hurricane Matthew must serve damage victims in a more effective way. That's why I was proud to vote today to modernize their response grant system and make it more accountable to those impacted by disasters.

Congressman John Rutherford (R-FL) issued the following statement after voting in favor of the American Health Care Act, which repeals and replaces Obamacare:   “After seven years of broken promises, it is clear that Obamacare is on the path to collapse and the American people are paying the price. Just this week, we saw two more announcements of insurance carriers leaving the marketplace, leaving consumers with few or even no choices for coverage. Obamacare has given us fewer choices, skyrocketing premiums, higher deductibles, and higher taxes. It is not working and we must act. I promised the people of Northeast Florida that we would protect them from this misguided law, and today we have voted to do just that.  “The American Health Care Act repeals Obamacare, its mandates, taxes, and rules, which will lower consumer costs. It replaces it with a system that empowers individuals and families to obtain affordable, quality health care coverage. No longer will Americans be mandated to buy a plan they cannot afford, do not want, and cannot even use. The legislation maintains the guarantee that Americans with pre-existing conditions will have affordable coverage, and it continues to allow children to stay on their parents’ plan until age 26.  “While this represents a big step toward the market-based reforms needed to make health care more affordable and accessible for all, we must continue to drive down the cost of health care. I will continue working to increase access to quality, affordable health care for every Northeast Florida family.”  https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/rutherford-votes-repeal-and-replace-obamacare

There has been a lot of misinformation about the American Health Care Act. For example, the House voted unanimously to ensure members of Congress are NOT exempt from the bill. Also, the bill absolutely maintains affordable coverage for those with pre-existing conditions. Read more here: http://www.speaker.gov/general/american-health-care-act-your-questions-answered-part-3
I met with veterans and hardworking staff today at the Jacksonville VA clinic. I'll continue to work to ensure our veterans get the care they deserve.
Great visit with our future leaders. Thank you for having me!

This Police Week, I was honored to stand with our law enforcement officers, their families, and our communities to recognize the sacrifices our law enforcement officers make everyday. I was espeically honored to recognize one of our very own fallen heros, Nassau County Deputy Eric Oliver. Deputy Oliver died doing something he loved, protecting and serving our community. He was well respected in the Northeast Florida community, as a husband, father, son, and Navy veteran.    Law Enforcement is a noble profession because these men and women serve with self-sacrifice. Officer Beliso, Special Agent McGuire, and Deputy Eric Oliver laid their lives on the altar of freedom and we will never forget their dedication to our nation.
Law enforcement is proud President Donald J. Trump lit the White House blue to honor law enforcement for their service and sacrifice. Thank you, Mr. President!

In Case You Missed It! Last week I introduced the TRACER Act. This legislation would require state and local law enforcement to be notified when federal prisoners convicted of terrorism charges are released from prison into their communities. Read more here: https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-rutherford-introduces-tracer-act

Today, I was proud to vote for the Veterans Appeals Improvement and Modernization Act of 2017, a bill I cosponsored. Our veterans deserve a responsive, accountable, and efficient VA that works for them. This legislation takes important steps in reforming the broken appeals process that has plagued the VA for years. I look forward to the Senate passing similar legislation. House Committee on Veterans' Affairs For more information on the bill, click here: https://veterans.house.gov/uploadedfiles/hr_2288_appeals_bill_one_pager.pdf

HAPPENING NOW: Watch the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs hearing where we will review President Donald J. Trump's budget requests with Secretary Shulkin. Watch here: https://veterans.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=1755

Today, Congressman John Rutherford in partnership with Senator Rubio, Senator Nelson, and the entire Florida delegation sent a letter to Air Force Secretary Heather Wilson to advocate for the basing of the F-35 Joint Strike Fighters at the 125th Fighter Wing in Jacksonville. To read the letter click here: https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/rutherford-leads-letter-fighting-base-f-35s-jacksonville

This Memorial Day, let us pause to remember the brave men and women of our Armed Forces who gave the ultimate sacrifice for our nation.  By continuing Memorial Day traditions, uplifting the loved ones of our fallen service members, and promoting a culture of service, we will forever commemorate those who gave the ultimate sacrifice.  I was honored to attend the Jacksonville National Cemetery Service and the City of Jacksonville Memorial Day Observance to recognize and thank the brave men and women who lost their lives in service to our nation. Thank you, we will never forget your bravery and commitment to our nation.
Hurricane season starts tomorrow. Visit bit.ly/2d3arRn to learn more about preparedness essentials to keep your family safe.

Today, I was proud to present Mr. John Milton with the Bronze Star Medal in honor of his father, Master Sergeant Glenn Milton.   Master Sergeant Milton was awarded the Bronze Star Medal for his valor on the battlefield during the New Guinea campaign in the Pacific during WWII.   While he passed away a few years ago, today I have the honor of presenting the award to his son to accept on his behalf. Thank you John for keeping your father's legacy alive. We will never forget his commitment and dedication to our nation.

Today, I was proud to be a part of the 23rd annual Miracle on Ashley Street that offers meals, hope, & jobs for those with the most need in our Northeast Florida community. Thank you to the volunteers and staff for a great event.
On the 73rd anniversary of D-Day, we remember the greatest generation for their bravery and sacrifice ensuring freedom for the U.S.A and our allies.

I'm proud to be a part of the most productive Congress in the modern-era! To date, the House has passed 158 bills and President Donald J. Trump signed 37 of those bills. We eliminated Obama-era regulations, passed the health care bill and sent it to the Senate. We rolled back 14 rules that Obama issued at the end of his term, saving almost $4 billion dollars. Looking forward to continuing this pace and working hard for Northeast Florida!

Tomorrow we join Orlando and our fellow Floridians across the state to pause at 9:00am and share in a moment of silence to honor the victims of the Pulse terror attack.  The legacy and memory of the 49 innocent victims will live on in the hearts of so many. While we can never completely heal from the  pain of these losses, we can join our fellow Floridians in remembering the impact their lives made, and honor their legacies.   We will also remember those in the community who came to the aid of those in need- the first responders, police officers, and faith leaders. Let us never forget this attack on innocent lives, and vow to do all in our power to stop those individuals responsible for Radical Islamic terrorism.

I am excited to have been appointed to the House Judiciary Committee today. Looking forward to strengthening the justice system and supporting the rule of law across our nation. https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-rutherford-named-house-judiciary-committee

Today, the House passed the Department of Veterans Affairs Accountability and Whistleblower Protection Act to bring accountability to the Department of Veterans Affairs. This will create a culture of accountability at VA and our nation's heroes will get the care they rightly deserve. The VA needs to change and I believe this bill is a huge step in that direction.   I look forward to President Trump signing this important legislation.

My thoughts and prayers go out to Steve Scalise, Capitol Police, aides, and staff involved in the senseless act of violence this morning during the congressional baseball game practice.  Thank you to our heroic Capitol Police Officers and the First Responders at the scene.
Wishing the brave men and women of the 125th Fighter Wing a swift and safe deployment. Thank you for your service. Your courage and devotion are greatly appreciated!

LEGISLATIVE UPDATE - My bill, the Streamlining DHS Overhead Act passed the U.S. House. Read more here: https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/legislative-update-rep-rutherford-s-streamlining-dhs-overhead-act-passes-us

In Case You Missed It: Watch my questioning from the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs where we examined the president’s budget request for the Veterans Health Administration. I was encouraged by the VA moving towards a 21st Century health records system, but we need to ensure there is a seamless transition and no delays in care.
Always great seeing Governor Rick Scott! Thanks for coming to D.C. to help us fight for Florida families.

Traveling through my district, I have heard from countless business owners and residents along the North Florida coasts who are concerned about the risks of seismic testing to our healthy ocean fisheries.   While future offshore drilling activities in the Atlantic would put our communities at risk down the road, seismic testing threatens our fragile coastal economies today.   Our coastal economy should not be put at undue risk at a time when our booming oil and gas production is more than enough to meet our current energy needs.  That's why I sent a letter to Secretary Zinke opposing seismic testing in the Atlantic. Read more here: https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/rep-rutherford-leads-letter-opposing-seismic-testing-atlantic
NA

As a history buff myself, I was honored to host him and his family at my office in Washington, D.C. and show them around our nation’s Capitol. I’m so glad Mateo is cancer-free, and wish him the best as he attends college in the spring. Dreams Come True of Jacksonville, Inc.  http://bit.ly/2sZUbZ8

As we celebrate the 4th of July, reflect on what it means to be American. Thank our brave service members, law enforcement officers, and all those who serve our nation to defend our freedom.  Wishing all my friends and neighbors across Northeast Florida a safe and happy Independence Day!

Today, I was appointed to the House Judiciary Committee Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations. Looking forward to using my background to support the rule of law across our nation. https://judiciary.house.gov/press-release/goodlatte-announces-new-republican-member-subcommittee-assignments-115th-congress/

It is with deep sadness that I join all Floridians in mourning the loss of another young warrior, Marine Sergeant Joseph Murray, who gave up his life while serving our nation. Hearing of Sgt. Murray’s life, his love of his wife and four young children, his faith, and his dedication to others shows he was and is an inspiration to all. We are forever indebted to Joseph for his selfless service and incredible sacrifice. My sincerest condolences and heartfelt prayers go out to his family and loved ones.   http://jacksonville.com/news/military/2017-07-12/marine-jacksonville-killed-mississippi-plane-crash-remembered-man-faith

Rutherford Votes to Rebuild Our Military, Increase Pay for Our Troops: https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/rutherford-votes-rebuild-our-military-increase-pay-our-troops  “Today’s vote fulfills the promise that we made to our military at home and abroad to continue to rebuild our capabilities and keep our nation safe. Northeast Florida is home to critical military installations that are essential to foreign and domestic missions, and this legislation bolsters thetools required to execute their duties. It also makes key investments in our military’s readiness, while providing a 2.4% pay increase for our brave men and women in uniform. I remain committed to ensuring our troops have the resources they need to protect our nation and am proud we voted today on a bipartisan basis to reach our goal of maintaining peace through strength.” - Congressman John Rutherford
ICYMI: Rutherford Applauds Legislation to Expand, Extend GI Bill  https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/rutherford-applauds-legislation-expand-extend-gi-bill

Today, I introduced common sense immigration legislation to allow job creators who have been in the U.S. on an E-2 investor treaty visa for more than 10 years to apply for legal permanent residence. Read about it here: https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-rutherford-introduces-legislation-reform-entrepreneur-visa-program
Looking forward to throwing the first pitch at the Jacksonville Jumbo Shrimp game tonight!

Rutherford Commends the House for Passing the Harry W. Colmery Veterans Educational Assistance Act of 2017: https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-rutherford-commends-house-passing-forever-gi-bill  "This package makes important reforms to the GI Bill, including removing the time frame in which it must be used, to improve veterans’ access to quality education." -Congressman John Rutherford

The United States will not tolerate aggression from hostile nations that seek to inflict harm on America and her allies. From North Korea’s nuclear ambitions, to Russia’s illegal activities in Ukraine and attempts to interfere in our and other democratic elections, to Iran’s sponsorship of terrorism, we must use every tool at our disposal to hold these regimes accountable for their actions. https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/rutherford-votes-sanction-north-korea-russia-and-iran

Great news for our veterans in NE Florida – the House voted today to not only extend the Choice program, but also begin the process of establishing a new VA clinic in Jacksonville.  We are making progress in the effort to restore the VA.  Read more about it here: https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/rutherford-lawson-vote-va-program-funding-progress-lease-outpatient-clinic
Enjoyed spending time with the Rotary Club of Jacksonville-Oceanside and updating them on the progress we've made in D.C. Thanks for having me!

American Heroes Week has drawn to a close, but as we continue to pay tribute to our police, I ask you to join me in reflecting on the many officers who risked their lives for the service of others. Read my reflection here: https://www.gop.gov/heroes-dont-ask-acknowledgement/

Technology plays an important role in securing our borders. Watch my video from the House Homeland Security Committee hearing - “Deter, Detect and Interdict: Technology’s Role in Securing the Border”:

I was proud to vote for legislation that empowers our servicemen and women, and I applaud the Senate for passing this important legislation. When our brave men and women put on the uniform to protect our nation, we have a sacred responsibility to provide them, and their families, with opportunities in repayment for their service and sacrifice. Looking forward to President Trump signing this legislation to provide the biggest expansion of college aid for military veterans in a decade.  http://jacksonville.com/news/national/2017-08-02/congress-oks-big-boost-gi-bill-college-aid-veterans

The House Committee on Homeland Security has been examining the current terror threat landscape and what additional measures the U.S. can take to mitigate the threat. See what we've been discussing on the Task Force Denying Terrorists Entry into the United States here:
JaxPort plays a crucial role in securing our maritime borders. Watch a Homeland Security Committee hearing discussing technology and our ports:

In Case You Missed It: Watch my interview last week with Wjxt4 Kent Justice on WJXT4 The Local Station / News4JAX. https://www.news4jax.com/this-week-in-jacksonville/this-week-in-jacksonville-1502028482809

Enjoyed my time with the Blinded Veterans Association at their National Convention today in Jacksonville. It was an honor to be surrounded by our selfless veterans and it's encouraging to hear about the technological advances available in vision rehabilitation and optometry. I will continue to work hard every day on the Veterans Affairs committee to provide our veterans with certainty they deserve and the benefits they've earned. Thank you for your service!

I remain deeply saddened by the violence and loss of life in Charlottesville this weekend.  We must continue to stand together against hate, racism, and violence like that displayed by White Supremacists, Neo-Nazis, and the KKK, all of which have no place in America.  Those involved in that violence will be brought to swift justice.  As we continue to pray for the innocents harmed, let us also join with the people of Spain in prayer in the wake of today’s tragic attack and condemn  those that commit violence.

Prayers for Jacksonville Sheriff's Office Officers Michael Fox and Kevin Jarrell and law enforcement throughout our nation. Law enforcement officers risk their lives every day to keep us safe. The news from Northeast Florida, Kissimmee, and Pennsylvania is tragic. I join my brothers and sisters in uniform to honor their service and sacrifice.

We are a step closer to providing veterans in Northeast Florida increased access to both excellent healthcare and education.  When our brave men and women put on the uniform to protect our nation, we have a responsibility to provide for them and their families.  These two pieces of legislation will make it easier for veterans to access the health and education benefits they have earned.    https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/rutherfords-veterans-education-bill-signed-law

I commend President Trump’s decision as Commander-in-Chief to refocus our strategy in Afghanistan and South Asia to eliminate the threat of terrorism in the region.  It was a powerful message and signal to the Afghan people, our allies, and terrorists that America will not lead from behind when it comes to threats of terror that can hurt our citizens and our allies.  With last night’s address to the nation, the President demonstrated his ability to thoughtfully consider advice from his national security team, make a decision based on national security priorities rather than political goals, and clearly articulate the implications of these decisions to the American people and most importantly our brave servicemen and women at home and abroad.  The key pillars of this strategy – using conditions on the ground rather than artificial timelines to make military decisions, integrating our instruments of diplomatic, economic, and military power to reach our goals, and abandoning nation-building as a goal – are strong and prudent.  I also applaud the President for applying pressure on Pakistan and recognizing that they cannot continue to be a safe haven for the terror that threatens the region and the world.  We in Congress will continue to conduct oversight over American military operations in Afghanistan to ensure that we adhere to the guidelines the President set forth in his speech.  And we will ensure that our brave men and women in uniform have the resources they need to safely and swiftly conduct their missions to keep us safe at home.

Thank you to the new Secretary of the Navy Richard Spencer for visiting Jacksonville this week to see firsthand how the missions carried out by the brave men and women at NS Mayport and NAS Jacksonville keep our country safe.  As Secretary Spencer said, the Navy faces a number of challenges as seen by the recent issues in the Pacific Fleet.  We must ensure we are giving the Navy, and all of the services, the resources they need to carry out the missions with which they are tasked.  The threats are too significant and the missions are too great to do any less.  I look forward to working with the new Secretary and my colleagues in Congress on these critical issues.   http://jacksonville.com/news/military/2017-08-24/we-cannot-be-our-own-worst-enemy-navy-secretary-says-recent-ship-collisions
In Case You Missed It: Read my interview with the St. Augustine Record http://staugustine.com/news/local-news/2017-08-26/rutherford-still-trump-most-issues
Today I had the privilege to spend time at the North Florida School of Special Education with their students and faculty. Every student has amazing talent, kindness & joy. Proud of each one of you!

My staff and I are closely monitoring Hurricane Irma and have been in contact with the State Emergency Operations Center. While it is still too early to determine what direct impacts Irma will have on Northeast Florida, it is important to have a hurricane plan in place for your family. To help you get prepared visit www.jaxready.com or www.floridadisaster.org. To get updates from the National Weather Center visit www.noaa.gov. I also encourage you to listen to the local news and check weather alerts.
For a complete list of hurricane preparedness and response contacts visit: https://rutherford.house.gov/issues/hurricane-prepardness
Follow me on Twitter at @RepRutherfordFL for safety tips, local alerts, and live updates on Hurricane Irma.

Today I'm spending the day traveling throughout Northeast Florida meeting local leaders and visiting emergency operations centers in preparation of Hurricane Irma. St. Johns County Emergency Management and St. Johns County Sheriff's Office are a great group of dedicated public servants. Be sure to listen to their warnings and evacuations!

I stopped by the Duval County Emergency Operations Center and the Nassau County Emergency Operations Center for Hurricane Irma briefings and to thank everyone for their hard work as Florida faces this storm. I also pledged my full support to work together to prepare for and respond to this storm. Thank you to all of the emergency management officials, law enforcement officers, and first responders for your hard work keeping Northeast Floridians safe. My thoughts and prayers are with the entire state and those in the path of Irma.

Sixteen years ago, the America we knew changed forever. Today, we come together to recognize the anniversary of one of the greatest tragedies in our nation's history, the 9/11 attacks on America. I urge all Americans to take a moment to honor the more than 3,000 American lives lost on that day; the brave first responders, law enforcement officers, firefighters, and the family members of lost loved ones.  We must stand united as a grateful nation and be thankful for the countless men and women who continue to defend our freedoms. The sacrifice, courage, and resilience Americans demonstrated in response represents the very best our country has to offer. And on this day, we are reminded to maintain our commitment to preventing terrorism and protecting our citizens. God bless you all as we remember the attacks of September 11th.

Today, I visited many parts of FL04 to see the damage caused by Hurricane Irma firsthand. It was great to work together at the St. Johns County Emergency Management Center with Senator Marco Rubio and Congressman Ron DeSantis to discuss ways the federal government can be helpful to recovery efforts.  I was proud of the kindness, care and generosity of our community. Thank you to everyone that came together to get our neighbors through this storm, including our great first responders, law enforcement officers, firefighters, linemen and women, and city employees. While we are still assessing the full extent of damage, my door is always open. I encourage you to reach out to my office for help with federal agencies as we face Irma recovery together.

All 3 of our FL04 counties - Nassau, Duval, and St. Johns County - are now eligible for individual disaster assistance and public assistance from FEMA Federal Emergency Management Agency. More information on how to apply here: https://www.disasterassistance.gov

The past few days I visited hurricane shelters, emergency management headquarters, the American Red Cross, toured the state with the United States Coast Guard, and saw the destruction Irma caused in Florida firsthand. I was proud of the resilience and kindness of neighbors helping friends and strangers. In the days and weeks ahead, people in our communities will need all the resources they can get to help rebuild. I will continue to work with FEMA and the Small Business Administration to ensure Northeast Florida has the resources they need to rebuild. Thank you to our brave Coast Guard for rescuing hundreds of people in FL04, fellow Floridians,  all the volunteers who provided shelter for evacuees, a meal, and a friendly face. I'm very proud of all the men and women who saved lives in Florida!

If you are in need of assistance, please don't hesitate to contact our office at 904-831-5205.

Today Is Gold Star Mothers' Day. A day when we recognize the women who's lives have been changed forever through the ultimate sacrifice their sons and daughters made in service to our nation. There are no words to describe the debt our nation owes these families. Please take a moment today to remember our Gold Star mothers and families and thank a service member and veteran for all they have sacrificed for our great nation.

In June, I wrote a letter to the South Atlantic Fishery Council requesting to open the red snapper fishery in the South Atlantic. Yesterday, the South Atlantic Council announced they passed a provision to reopen the fishery for short seasons in 2017 and 2018.  This is a great victory for fishing in our state. Florida is the fishing capital of the world, with more than 3 million anglers who generate $9.6 billion in economic impact. This is a tremendous step toward growing our First Coast fishing economy, but I will keep fighting in Washington for our South Atlantic anglers until we have a long-term solution to properly managing all of our fishery stocks. http://jacksonville.com/news/metro/2017-09-19/officials-ok-red-snapper-fall-season

Today's passage of the disaster tax-relief bill is great news for Florida, Texas, Puerto Rico, the U.S. Virgin Islands and everywhere impacted by hurricanes. It's important that resources are provided so families and businesses can recover and rebuild stronger than before. I look forward to President Trump swiftly signing this bill, and will continue to work hard to help our community recover. https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2017/09/28/special-tax-breaks-hurricanes-harvey-irma-and-maria-disasters-approved-house/711985001/

FEMA Federal Emergency Management Agency opened a disaster recovery center today in Jacksonville. Disaster Recovery Centers are temporary disaster resources that allow state and local officials to maximize their reach to as many affected areas and survivors as possible.   They offer in-person support to individuals and small business owners. Recovery specialists from the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA), and the state, are available to provide assistance to anyone with filling out applications or updating their status.  The Disaster Recovery Center's address is below:  Johnson Family YMCA 5700 Cleveland Road Jacksonville, FL  32209 Hours: 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.  Closing Sunday Oct. 8th at 8:00pm  As more centers open, survivors may locate one near them at https://www.fema.gov/disaster-recovery-centers or by calling FEMA Helpline at 800-621-3362, (TTY) 800-462-7585. Helpline numbers are  open from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m. EDT, seven days a week.

I was proud to recognize and thank local, state, and federal officials after Hurricane Irma on the House floor. The Florida delegation is unified to ensure that Floridians receive the Federal support they need to recover from this horrible natural disaster.  We also understand the urgent needs of Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands and are prepared to stand by them as they face the daunting task of rebuilding their communities. We will continue to work together with our State, local, and Federal officials to ensure that Florida, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands can recover and build even stronger than before.

On Monday, we all woke up to the horrific news about the tragedy in Las Vegas. I know America is united in mourning as we remember those lost or injured in this senseless massacre. Thank God for our first responders that saved countless lives. Join me in praying for all of the victims and their families.

Following the tragic events on October 1, 2017 in Las Vegas, I co-signed a letter to the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) urging a thorough re-evaluation of bump-stock devices reported to have been used by the perpetrator to dramatically increase the discharge rate of his firearms as he carried out these senseless killings. The letter is being led by Members in Congress who were previously in the Armed Forces, Rep. Kinzinger, Rep. Gallagher, and Rep. McSally.  I believe it is time for Congress and federal regulators to evaluate the regulation of bump-stocks. I signed onto a letter sent to the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives urging them to re-evaluate the regulation of bump-stock devices. On the morning of October 2nd, we were shocked to awaken to news of the horrific event in Las Vegas and the role bump-stocks may have played. It is our duty as legislators to review policies to keep our citizens safe while ensuring the protection of our constitutional rights.  Read a copy of the letter below:   The Honorable Thomas E. Brandon Acting Director Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives 99 New York Ave NE Washington, DC 20226   On the morning of October 2, we were shocked and appalled to awaken to news of the horrific events that occurred during the night at a concert in Las Vegas.  As a nation, we mourn the loss of life, we condemn the senseless and evil attack on these innocent victims, and we praise the brave actions by our first responders and bystanders alike.    Reports in the aftermath of this tragedy indicate that the perpetrator may have used a commercially available mechanism to modify the rate at which his weapons were able to discharge. Commonly called a bump-stock—also known as a “slide fire”—this mechanism is designed to replace the weapon’s original shoulder stock to allow the rest of the weapon to slide backward and forward, harnessing the kinetic energy of the weapon’s recoil to allow for a more rapid trigger pull, thereby dramatically increasing the rate of discharge.   It is also our understanding that this mechanism is technically legal under the National Firearms Act (26 U.S.C. 5845(b)) and the Gun Control Act (18 U.S.C. 921(a)(23)). In fact, we have enclosed two letters from the Firearms Technology Branch (FTB) of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives (ATF) dated June 7, 2010 and April 2, 2012 which indicate this mechanism is not implicated by the laws that apply to machineguns.  In light of the tragic events in Las Vegas, we respectfully request that FTB-ATF work expeditiously to re-evaluate bump stocks and similar mechanisms to ensure full compliance with federal law. If the re- evaluation shows otherwise, we request that you move swiftly to issue appropriate rulings concerning the manufacture, sale, transfer, and importation of these mechanisms, as well as any other mechanism that is expressly designed to simulate the automatic rate of fire of a machinegun. For our part, we will be studying legislative options to close any loopholes that might exist in current statutes governing the regulation of machineguns.   We trust that you will undertake this request expeditiously and thoroughly, and we thank you for your thoughtful consideration. Should you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us directly.   Sincerely,

The quickest way to apply for federal assistance is online at www.disasterassistance.gov,  through a smartphone or tablet at www.fema.gov/apply-assistance, or by calling 800-621-3362.

Mobile Office Hours this Friday, October 13th, at the Oceanway Community Center from 2:00pm to 4:00pm. A member of my staff will be on hand to help with federal agencies, or issues including Medicare, Social Security, or Veterans Affairs. They can also answer questions regarding the FEMA process as we rebuild from Hurricane Irma. The Oceanway Community Center is located at 12215 Sago Ave W., Jacksonville, FL 32218.  A Disaster Recovery Center opened today in Yulee to help Florida storm survivors. The DRC’s hours are 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. until close of business Oct.15. Disaster Recovery Centers offer in-person support to individuals and small business owners. The DRC is at the Former Nassau County Sheriff’s Office,76001 Bobby Moore Circle, Yulee, FL 32097, 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. This location will be open until Oct. 15th.

As we celebrate the 242nd birthday of the United States Navy, we recognize generations of brave men and women who selflessly served our nation. As the son of a Navy veteran, I have always been proud of the Navy’s distinguished heritage. The Navy’s mission to maintain, train, and equip combat-ready Naval forces capable of winning wars, deterring aggression, and maintaining freedom of the seas has been notably carried out.  No matter where sailors serve, their contributions are vital to fulfilling this mission.   I am proud that Northeast Florida is home to both Naval Air Station Jacksonville and Naval Station Mayport and has Naval Submarine Base Kings Bay nearby.  Over 150,000 veterans and over 50,000 active duty and reserve members and their families call our area home.   As we celebrate the legacy of our United States Navy, we are reminded of our duty to support our military, military families, and veterans.  The honor, courage, commitment, and sacrifice that generations of Americans have made throughout the history of the Navy is to be celebrated.  Their sacrifices, and those of their families, are not taken for granted by their community neighbors.  We thank the Navy for 242 years of dedicated service to our Nation.

Many homeowners and renters who suffered damage as a result of Hurricane Irma - nearly 2.4 million in Florida - have registered with FEMA, the first step in the recover process.  Important deadlines to register for assistance can be found below:   October 31st - Unemployment Assistance and the Florida Small Business Emergency Bridge Loan Program November 5th - Request for Public Assistance  November 9th - Federal Disaster Assistance and U.S. Small Business Administration Low-Interest Loans  The quickest way to apply for federal assistance is online at www.disasterassistance.gov. Survivors may also apply by phone at 800-621-3362 (Voice, 711 or VS) or 800-462-7585 (TTY).

Today, I was proud to vote for the Resilient Federal Forests Act of 2017. Forest fires have been destroying our national forests, most recently in California, and they are fighting for survival. By voting for the Resilient Federal Forests Act, we can ensure our federal land managers have the immediate tools they need to better manage our public lands, while reducing the risk of catastrophic wildfires. The Forest Service estimates that at least 58 million acres of national forests are at a high risk of catastrophic wildfire. And currently, Forest Service employees spend 40% of their man power hours on paperwork. This bill cuts down on bureaucracy while increasing the pace and scale of forest management to ensure our communities and forests stay safe.

America's Tax Code is broken. For too long, a complex Tax Code, high rates, and burdensome regulations have held back opportunities for hardworking families. By passing the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act It is estimated almost 100,000 new full-time jobs will be created in Florida with an estimated increase of over $4,000 in income for median households. This bill is pro-family, pro-business, and will give our economy a boost.

Today, I voted in favor of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, a major tax reform measure to reduce the tax burden on individuals, families, and small businesses. Read my statement here:  https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/rep-rutherford-votes-cut-middle-class-taxes-create-jobs

I am committed to protecting sportsmen’s access to natural resources, which is why I have pushed for recreational angler’s access to federal red snapper fisheries. It's great news the fishery opened again for our anglers, and I'll keep fighting for policies that keep our fisheries strong.   The recreational harvest of red snapper in South Atlantic federal waters will reopen for three days in December 2017. Recreational harvest will reopen 12:01 a.m. on December 8, 2017, and close 12:01 a.m. on December 11, 2017.  https://www.news4jax.com/weather/an-additional-weekend-added-in-december-to-red-snapper-mini-season-of-2017

Rep. Rutherford: Constitutional Right to Bear Arms Should Not Stop at State Lines   "We want good people carrying guns. In my years in law enforcement, I have seen good, law-abiding citizens use legal firearms to stop dangerous people from harming themselves, their families, their neighbors, and other innocent lives. Law-abiding citizens who are authorized to carry firearms should have the ability to stop a violent incident before law enforcement can intervene."  Read my full statement here: https://rutherford.house.gov/media/press-releases/rep-rutherford-constitutional-right-bear-arms-should-not-stop-state-lines

Today we reflect on the lives lost 76 years ago at the sudden attack on Pearl Harbor, and the brave men and women who entered into World War II the very next day. This day is a reminder of the importance of defending our freedoms and our flag, saluting our military men and women, and praying for the continued strength of our great nation.

Thank you to FBI Director Wray for testifying before the House Judiciary Committee today. His testimony was critical to allowing Congress to hold the FBI accountable to the American people. As former Sheriff, I often think about the perceived politicization of our law enforcement agencies and the impact that could have on operations. That is why my colleagues are so concerned regarding the private communications by FBI personnel tasked with the Clinton investigation. This type of bias goes against the ethics of the FBI and of other law enforcement agencies – the American people deserve impartial enforcement of our laws. Watch my testimony and discussion here:

This week, I was proud to vote for the Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act that ensures law-abiding citizens’ Second Amendment rights do not end at state lines. It also allows residents with a concealed carry license to travel between states without worrying about conflicting laws. Happy birthday to the National Guard! Although the nation officially celebrates the National Guard’s founding in Massachusetts in 1636, Florida had our own version of the National Guard, called the Florida Militia, that dates back to 1565. This means Florida was home to the first National Guard! No matter the founding year, they have always been “Always Ready, Always There!” and for that, we are thankful. Florida National Guard
